headline.main: THE METROPOLITAN POLICE.; Quarterly Report of Superintendent Kennedy.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Honorable the Board of Metropolitan Police Commissioners: GENTLEMEN: Pursuant to the requirements of the Statute, I respectfully submit my Second Quarterly Report "of the state of the Metropolitan Police District," for the term ending Oct. 31, 1860.

docs.snippet: DISTRESSING SUICIDE OF A MARRIED LADY. Coroner SCHIRMER On Sunday afternoon held an inquest at the house No. 137 Second-avenue, upon the body of Mrs. CAROLINE OLMSTEAD, a young married lady, who had been found dead in her bedroom on Saturday last.

headline.main: GENERAL CITY NEWS.; Evacuation Day. THE PARADE OF THE MILITARY. An Infant Murdered by its Mother. Police Reports. INEXCUSABLE CURIOSITY.

headline.main: EFFECTS OF THE LATE GALE.; Great Numbo of Disasters on the Lakes Report from Buffalo, Oswego and Sackett's Harbor List of Vessels Lost and Damaged Heavy Fall of Snow, &c. Slave Extradition Case in Canada. THE BURCH DIVORCE CASE. SEVENTH DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The storm of Saturday and Sunday was the most severe that has occurred here for many years. The damage to buildings in the city was not heavy, the demolition of the casting-house of PALMER WADSWORTH, which was in course of erection, being the principal case.

docs.snippet: Indications to-day are decidedly in favor of an early change in the Cabinet. The state of affairs in Georgia, and the position of Secretary COBB has so affected him as to lay him up sick in bed.

headline.main: THE SECESSION MOVEMENT.; More Rumors About Changes in the Cabinet. INTERESTING FROM SOUTH CAROLINA. Indications of Conservatism in the South. Hon. Alexander H. Stephens Chosen Delegate to the Georgia Convention. The Palmetto Flag Groaned at and Hissed in Baltimore. Another Great Union Mass Meeting to be Held in Virginia. OUR TELEGRAPHIC DISPATCHES. FROM WASHINGTON. PROBABLE RESIGNATION OF SECRETARIES COBB AND THOMPSON PREMATURE ANNOUNCEMENT OF JUDGE TANEY'S RESIGNATION FEW ARRIVALS OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.WASHINGTON, Monday, Nov. 26. FROM SOUTH CAROLINA. MEETING OF THE LEGISLATURE THE FIRST BUSINESS IN ORDER THE GOVERNOR'S MESSAGE, &C. AFFAIRS AT CHARLESTON. FROM VIRGINIA. THE RETURN OF MR. RUFFIN FROM SOUTH CAROLINA ANOTHER UNION MASS MEETING TO BE HELD FINANCIAL MATTERS. FROM MARYLAND. THE PALMETTO FLAG HISSED IN BALTIMORE SIGNIFICANT DEMONSTRATIONS. FROM GEORGIA. MESSRS. STEPHENS AND PICKENS CHOSEN DELEGATES TO THE STATE CONVENTION, ETC. PROBABLE RE-ELECTION OF MR. CLINGMAN BANK SUSPENSIONS IN GEORGIA. BANK SUSPENSIONS IN TENNESSE

docs.lead_paragraph: Indications to-day are decidedly in favor of an early change in the Cabinet. The state of affairs in Georgia, and the position of Secretary COBB has so affected him as to lay him up sick in bed.

headline.main: THE BURCH DIVORCE CASE.; Testimony of Charles Laytoa, Mr. Burch's Man of All Work. THIRD DAY MORNING SESSION, CONTINUED. Cross-Examination of the Gardener His Alterations in his Testimony Remarkable Oblivion as to Dates The Jury not to Read the Newspapers. Highly Interesting Testimony of Mrs. Burch's Confidence How Mrs. Burch told Mr. Burch's Niece all about her Flirtations What a Fascinating Man Stuart was History of the Scene at Mr. Burch's House He Compels his Wife to Write Letters at his Dictation. FOURTH DAY MORNING SESSION. [BY TELEGRAPH.] FIFTH DAY AFTERNOON SESSION. SIXTH DAY MORNING SESSION.

docs.snippet: On Friday night, Nov. 9, the new Lord Mayor of London, (Right Hon. W. CUBITT, M.P.,) entertained, according to custom, Her Majesty's Ministers, the Foreign Ambassadors, (of which only the Representatives of France and Sardinia were present,) the...

headline.main: GRAND CIVIC BANQUET IN LONDON.; Important Speeches of Count de Persigny, Lord Palmerston, Lord John Russell, and Others.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Friday night, Nov. 9, the new Lord Mayor of London, (Right Hon. W. CUBITT, M.P.,) entertained, according to custom, Her Majesty's Ministers, the Foreign Ambassadors, (of which only the Representatives of France and Sardinia were present,) the Judges of the land, the Ex-Ministers, the Corporation, and a distinguished company, at the Guildhall, which was magnificently decorated for the occasion.

docs.snippet: In this Court yesterday, before Judge RUSSELL, Ex-Alderman Wilson was brought forward for sentence, upon a conviction of having assaulted Alderman Russell. The Court remarked that but for the intercession of the complaining witness, and for the heavy...

headline.main: Court of General Sessions.; A LIGHT FINE--ASSAULT AND BATTERIES--A BURGLAR ON THE STAND.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court yesterday, before Judge RUSSELL, Ex-Alderman Wilson was brought forward for sentence, upon a conviction of having assaulted Alderman Russell. The Court remarked that but for the intercession of the complaining witness, and for the heavy damages ($5,000) which had been obtained in a civil suit, the sentence would have been severe. It would now be merely nominal a fine of six cents.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE BIENVILLE.; News from Cuba, Venezuela, and Mexico. DEATH OF AN AMERICAN EDITOR--SPANISH VIEWS OF THE LATE PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION--THE CIVIL WAR IN VENEZUELA--ABDICATION AND DEPARTURE OF MIRAMON FROM MEXICO CITY. COMMERCIAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steamship Bienville, J.D. BULLOOK, Commander, from New-Orleans on the 15th and Havana on the afternoon of the 18th inst., arrived at this port yesterday. The Bienville had a strong northerly gale from Hatteras up, and passed an unusually large number of vessels bound to the northward, but none within signal distance.

headline.main: Court of Oyer and Terminer.; HEAVY SENTENCES--ENRIGHT SENT TO SING SING TWO YEARS, GORDON TO THE PENITENTIARY ONE YEAR--MANHATTAN IN SING SING FOR LIFE--BILLY MULLIGAN CONVICTED. JUDGE'S CHARGE. CALENDAR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first business before Judge GOULD, yesterday, was the disposal of the case of John F. Williams, indicted for the murder of his wife. He had previously pleaded not guilty, but now withdrew his plea and changed it to guilty of manslaughter in the first degree. Counsel asked that the Court would deal leniently with the prisoner, as his intellect had been impaired by the previous habits of his life.
